      • guaranteeSpecificInstanceViablity

        public final void guaranteeSpecificInstanceViablity()
                                             throws PersistenceExceptionTypeNotPersistable
        Description copied from interface: PersistenceTypeHandler
        Guarantees that the PersistenceTypeHandler implementation is actually viably usable to handle instances. That is the natural purpose of type handlers, but there are exceptions, like type handlers created for abstract types or unpersistable types just to have a metadata representation that links a type and a type id.

        See occurances of PersistenceExceptionTypeNotPersistable.

        Throws:
        PersistenceExceptionTypeNotPersistable
        See Also:
        PersistenceExceptionTypeNotPersistable

        public final boolean isSpecificInstanceViable()
